Chuck Herrick wrote:
>Hello,
I> may have a ClassLoader problem. Running the same code, from a main()
which calls setUp() and mimics TestRunner, runs just fine from the
>commandline as well as from insdide TogetherJ. In fact, if I cut'n'paste
the -classpath from these, I still get the cast exception from a run via
TestRunner.
>java.lang.Object o = ctx.lookup("JNDI_NAME") ;
>System.out.println(o.getClass().getName()) ;
>System.out.println(o instanceof FoobarHome) ;
>should echo first the classname of the WebLogic-generated stub and then
the word true.

You are probably right about the class loader. Junit uses a customized
class loader. The ctx.lookup() uses a different class loader. To check this
put the following assert in your code.

java.lang.Object o = ctx.lookup("JNDI_NAME") ;
assertEquals(o.getClass().getClassLoader(), this.getClass().getClassLoader
());

You can run junit without a customized class loader, and this will solve
your problem.

Mike
